channel.title: Microsoft screwed me over
channel.description: Lol. Well, when i first got vista, from that time i'm like omfg rofl shit. It LAGS way too much. Before when i had windows xp, if i ran 14 viruses, I sware i'd still be running faster then this. So, a while ago, Jeebles told me that Windows XP is less then 600mb, so i'm like whoohoo I can put it on a audio disc. So I download a pirated version with lots of good feedback, on demonoid.com, I install it correctly. However, a error appears after starting it up for the first time. Something about Windows will now adjust your monitor blah blah.. SO, the only option is ok, so I click it. When I go to login screen, it appears that the screen is only 640x480. THEN, When i login, it says click this bubble to fix your monitor. I'm like woohoo! I click it, all it does is open the start menu :rolleyes:. When I go to Properties > Settings> And try to switch the resolution or whatever you want to call it, It doesn't move at all. :confused:. I try going online to seek assitance, but the problem is my ISP disc says this:YOU NEED 840X600 RESOLUTION, or something like that (I'm back on windows vista so don't give me piss if i have completely wrong information, i can't remember.) I went into help & support or whatever, and i did everything there it told me to do. Nope, nothing. Any ideas? Has microsoft made it so you can't go back to xp from vista lol? :|

item.title: Microsoft screwed me over
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Sounds like you need a monitor driver. Go to the distributors website and see if they have Drivers for XP there. Go to Device Manager and select Update Drivers for your monitor. Then point the wizard manually to where your located driver is located. If the file you downloaded in an exe, just run it.

I had a similar problem, in the end I swapped round the monitors so they were plugged into the different sockets of the gfx card and they worked fine then. No idea why.

:\ I read that on a forum. If worse comes to worse, you might have to venture in to your PC

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft screwed me over
item.dc:creator: @Heaven Heaven
item.description:
@Heaven wrote:

It says my monitor is Generic PnP Monitor, have no clue. It just says dell with a circle at bottom of it. My Processer is Pentium 4 2.80GHZ 2.79GHZ 512MB ( Don’t know why it says i have 2.80 and 2.79 at same time ;s
I’m 32 bit. There, all you need to know.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft screwed me over
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Download this, try changing the resolution again, and tell me what happens:
http://www.drivershq.com/Drivers/Devices/DELL-Intel-82865G-Graphics-Controller-Driver/3240/7/Drivers.aspx

It’s likely the drivers are installed, though. What monitor do you have? Can you post full specs?

Read full topic

item.description:

Heaven:

As for the video card:Intel 82865G Graphics Controller

There’s your problem

item.title: Microsoft screwed me over
item.dc:creator: @Heaven Heaven
item.description:
@Heaven wrote:

I was running on ubuntu before. Wont make a difference.[br][size=1]Posted on: September 16, 2007, 12:01:44 PM[/size][hr]
I have a Generic PnP Monitor, something i just found out now. When I go to advanced, then monitor, it says it’s using the “Default Monitor”

As for the video card:Intel 82865G Graphics Controller , is that my video card? Not sure, as I don’t know shit about harddware.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft screwed me over
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Heaven:

I TRIED TO GO BACK TO XP.

Reformat the hard drive with an Ubuntu live cd and then use your XP cd to install.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft screwed me over
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Heaven:

@ Un-Named. I forget where to install drivers on XP, honestly I do, haven’t used it for nearly a year

Find out what Vid card you have first. You might have to open up your PC to find out, seeing as it isn’t installed…If it is, you can tell by going to Run > dxdiag

If your vid card is built in to your mobo, your mobo should of come with a disk.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft screwed me over
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“Heaven, post:7, topic:143938”]Haha. I have 512MB of RAM rofl.
IT LAGS. I CANNOT INSTALL A ANTI VIRUS WITHOUT CRASHING. ( Ya i know they’re gay lul, but my mom thinks norton is god which it isn’t, i keep telling here that but she says NO D:)[/quote]

Norton + Vista + 512mb RAM = Hell
Vista + 512mb RAM = Hell
Norton + Vista = Hell

Therefore Norton = Hell and Vista = Hell

(I’d go back to xp if I were you)

item.title: Microsoft screwed me over
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Control Panel > Display > Settings…?

I just switched from Vista to XP. I have 2GBs of RAM and it was using 700mb of it idle. Good or bad? Two ways to look at it. Used RAM means good RAM as Vista ‘caches’ your RAM to make starting up programs much faster. Since switching back to XP, it has been much better, and I dont recommend Vista if you’re running on 1GB.

Heaven:

I ent spending 100$+ on something I can get for free.

You may have to activate the product when it’s installed. If so, goodluck :P. Here’s a useful post I found about activating it (if you have to)

Seeing as I have had to install XP a few times today, with no legit copy, I'll tell you how to get round it. On the activation screen there should be an option to do it by telephone. Do it that way, then, if it doesn't work, you'll be connected to a MSoft call center based in India. Here, just ask for an activation code after they have asked Windows version and your installation ID. You will understand it when you give it a try. Also, the phone call is free from a land based line. Note though, the department for activation is only open Mondays to Fridays.

Read full topic
